metadata.title: The Outback Animal Checklist
metadata.description: The right way to make sure you have the right Australian animals

steps.title: Check that you have a Koala
steps.description:
# Does it look like one?
It is easy to find out.

items.title: Is it a marsupial?
items.description: Marsupials are obviously mammalian and have a pouch on their underside

items.title: Make sure it eats eucalyptus
items.description: Almost no other animal can eat eucaluptus leaves, so this is a good diagnostic

items.title: Does it sleep the whole day?
Is it a marsupial?
items.description: Marsupials are obviously mammalian but possess a pouch on their underside

items.title: Does it have a long tail?
items.description: Kangaroos use their thick tail as a balance when jumping, and can use it as a support to rear up on when kicking

items.title: Does it jump around?
items.description: Over very short distances kangaroos will use their forepaws to balance on the ground and swing their legs forward. For longer distance movement, their jumping locomotion is unmistakeable.
